node.statement: KEY STRUCTURAL CONSTRAINT. From u = h + alpha: A = 2<h,alpha> + ||alpha||^2. From v = h + beta: B = 2<h,beta> + ||beta||^2. Target: AB >= ||h||^4. Investigate what structural properties of (alpha, beta) -- arising from the algebraic subordination equation F(z,w) = r'(z)p(w) - p'(w)r(z) = 0 -- guarantee this inequality. Key question: is <h,alpha> >= 0 always? If so, A >= ||alpha||^2 and the proof may close via AM-GM or Cauchy-Schwarz.
